title: Should Realtors Rent Leads or Own Their Pipeline?
content:
Key Takeaway: The choice between renting leads and owning your pipeline determines whether you build a sustainable business or a temporary income stream. Rented leads create dependency, while owned databases produce long-term growth, 10x higher conversions, and lasting business value that compounds over time.

TL;DR About Lead Ownership vs Renting

  • Purchased leads often cost agents $2,000–$10,000 monthly
  • Owned pipelines convert up to 10x higher
  • Lead flow ends the moment payments stop
  • Smart Agent Alliance gives free pipeline systems
  • Database ownership builds equity in your business

If you’ve been shelling out thousands each month for Zillow, Realtor.com, or “exclusive” Facebook leads that ghost you faster than your ex after a bad showing, welcome to the club. The average agent rents leads like they rent an apartment: high monthly cost, zero equity, and no control when the lease ends.

Meanwhile, the agents who own their pipelines are quietly building assets that keep producing deals year after year without buying another lead. The difference isn’t just strategy; it’s ownership. Owning your database is the business equivalent of owning your home. You build value with every relationship, every system, and every referral.

Table of Contents

The Problem With Renting Real Estate Leads
The Value of Owning Your Pipeline
How eXp Realty Supports Pipeline Ownership
The Payoff: Freedom from Lead Dependency
What Agents Also Ask About Lead Generation
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

The Problem With Renting Real Estate Leads

Renting real estate leads means paying ongoing fees for temporary access to prospects that multiple agents contact simultaneously. Once payments stop, lead flow ends, leaving agents with no lasting database or business asset.

The problem with renting leads isn’t just the high cost; it’s the lack of control. You’re building someone else’s business while draining your own profit margin. Lead companies charge $50 to $300 per name, often reselling the same “hot” lead to five or more agents at once (see examples in 12 Real Estate Lead Generation Strategies). Lead companies charge $50 to $300 per name, often reselling the same “hot” lead to five or more agents at once. Conversion rates hover around 1–2%, meaning 98% of your time and money evaporate into thin air.

It’s a treadmill disguised as progress: to maintain income, you must keep paying. Miss one month, and your lead flow stops cold. There’s no equity, no residual value, and no future income once the spending ends. Lead providers design it this way; they want you dependent enough to stay subscribed forever.

Take it from Mauricio, one of our team members, who says that he built his business around consistency, not dependency. Adding just five people a day to his database turned into 50+ closings a year—no paid leads required.”

Think of it like renting farmland: you pay for every harvest but never own the soil. You’re feeding someone else’s empire while hoping they’ll keep giving you access to the crops. Meanwhile, agents who own their databases are building generational wealth from their own fields.

The Value of Owning Your Pipeline

Owning your real estate pipeline means controlling lead flow through your own database, systems, and content rather than paying third-party providers. Owned pipelines generate higher-quality leads, consistent referrals, and long-term business equity you can grow or sell.

When you own your pipeline, every contact you collect becomes an appreciating asset, one that keeps paying dividends through repeat and referral business. Unlike rented leads that vanish the moment you stop paying, owned databases compound in value as your relationships grow stronger.

Here’s the math traditional brokerages don’t teach: a $3,000 monthly lead budget equals $36,000 a year, money that disappears with no residual value. Put that same effort into building a CRM-driven pipeline, and you create an asset that delivers leads for decades. Every past client becomes a future closing, every email sequence a digital salesperson working 24/7.

Owned pipelines also mean freedom from competition. You’re not racing to call a lead five seconds faster than ten other agents. You’re communicating with people who already know, like, and trust you. These are clients who choose you because you’ve built authority and familiarity over time.

Jessica, another team member, built a $300K GCI business by focusing on ownership, not panic. Once she started building her own audience, her database became both her safety net and her retirement plan. No more worrying about where the next deal would come from.

And let’s be honest, owning your pipeline feels good. It’s like finally buying your dream home after years of renting apartments with mystery stains and thin walls. You’re no longer at the mercy of someone else’s system. You own the foundation, the roof, and the mailbox where all the good referrals show up.

How eXp Realty Supports Pipeline Ownership

eXp Realty supports pipeline ownership through built-in technology, CRM tools, and global referral networks that help agents build sustainable lead systems they control (see eXp’s “My Link My Lead” tool). The model empowers agents to create repeat and referral business instead of relying on purchased leads.

Most brokerages talk about “support,” but what they really mean is “you’re on your own with a desk fee.” eXp Realty actually delivers tools that make ownership possible. Every agent starts with a CRM choice (BoldTrail, Lofty, or Cloze) CRM, access to top training for getting your own leads, and easy referral tools. All is already included in the $85 monthly brokerage fee. That’s your digital command center for nurturing leads, automating follow-ups, and tracking your database from anywhere.

The secret sauce? eXp’s model rewards ownership at every level. Agents who help others build pipelines share in the company’s revenue through revenue share, and just doing deals earns EXPI stock awards, real equity in the brokerage itself. This alignment creates a culture of collaboration, not competition. And, that’s very different then your local brokerage office, where agents may share a bit of good information but they hide the best tips.

Ken H. knows a thing or two about scale. His team closes over 900 deals a year. When he rebuilt his business with eXp’s CRM and systems, he stopped chasing leads and started owning them. Now every process runs itself, and his pipeline basically refuses to take a day off. 

In short, eXp Realty gives you the tools to own your pipeline instead of leasing someone else’s. Think of it like moving from paying rent to joining a co-op: you’re not just using the system, you’re profiting from it.

The Payoff: Freedom from Lead Dependency

Freedom from lead dependency allows real estate agents to generate consistent business without relying on paid lead providers. Owning your database creates predictable income, higher ROI, and long-term stability that grows even when marketing budgets shrink.

When agents stop renting leads and start owning their pipeline, everything changes. Stress drops, costs shrink, and business becomes predictable again. Instead of gambling $5,000 a month hoping for a few conversions, you’re running a system that compounds. Your CRM turns into a gold mine and each conversation today becomes tomorrow’s closing.

Agents who shift to ownership see the difference almost immediately. The first few months save thousands in expenses. Within a year, referrals and repeat clients replace cold prospects entirely. And by year three, you’ve built a self-sustaining lead engine that generates income even when you’re not prospecting daily.

That’s the real definition of leverage: your time and relationships working for you. Owned pipelines convert at 5–10x higher rates, cost pennies to maintain, and build business equity that can be sold or passed on later. Lead renters keep hustling for the next batch of internet strangers; pipeline owners wake up to new opportunities already in their inbox.

Marsha, a team member closing over $100,000 annually, decided burnout wasn’t a business plan. Two years after ditching paid leads, her pipeline still grows on autopilot. Every repeat client and referral feels like a bonus check from past effort. The best part? She’s doing it all on a four-day workweek 

Owning your lead system is the business equivalent of planting fruit trees instead of buying fruit. The first harvest takes effort, but once it starts producing, it never stops. And best of all? You never have to worry about someone else turning off your water supply.

What Agents Also Ask About Lead Generation

How long does it take to replace paid leads with owned ones?
Most agents replace paid-lead volume within 90–120 days by using CRM automation and consistent follow-up. Owned pipelines grow faster because you’re nurturing real relationships instead of buying cold names. The more conversations you start, the sooner momentum compounds.

Do I need a big audience to build an owned pipeline?
No. A strong real estate database beats a large social following every time. Even 100 engaged contacts can produce repeat and referral business if you stay consistent. Focus on connection and follow-up, not follower count.

Can I mix purchased and owned leads during the transition?
Absolutely. Many agents maintain short-term paid sources while their owned systems mature, using insights from lead management platforms like Pipeline ROI to segment and nurture contacts.

Why do owned pipelines convert better?
Because trust compounds. Leads from your own database already recognize your brand, communication style, and expertise. That familiarity increases response rates and reduces churn, often delivering 5–10x higher conversion than rented leads.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Choosing your sponsor when joining eXp Realty isn’t just a formality, it determines whether you start from scratch or plug straight into a complete business ecosystem. When you join Smart Agent Alliance, you don’t just gain a sponsor, you gain an entire infrastructure designed to help you own your pipeline from day one.

While most agents spend years piecing together systems, Smart Agent Alliance hands you a ready-to-run operation worth $7,000+ per year, completely free with sponsorship. Every bundle eliminates a major pain point that keeps agents dependent on expensive leads or disorganized marketing:

These aren’t theoretical “resources” buried in a backend folder. These are built, launched, and running the day you join. Systems attract leads 24/7, AI follows up automatically, and masterminds keep you improving weekly alongside top producers.

Choosing Smart Agent Alliance means never wondering where your next lead will come from. It’s the shortcut to owning your pipeline and your business future.

👉 Visit Smart Agent Alliance to see the full sponsorship details and start building your owned lead system today. Get more information about experienced agent problems and solutions here.

Frequently Asked Questions

How long does it take to replace purchased leads with an owned pipeline?

Agents who follow a structured CRM and nurture plan often replace their paid-lead volume within 90 to 120 days. Consistent outreach, follow-up automation, and database segmentation accelerate the transition from dependency to predictable organic lead flow.

What if I don’t have a database to start with?

Begin by importing past contacts, social media connections, and open-house visitors into a CRM. Then add new leads from website forms, social content, and referral sources. Over time, each contact becomes part of a self-sustaining lead ecosystem you control completely.

Do owned pipelines require more work than buying leads?

Initial setup takes effort, but automation handles most ongoing communication. Once your systems are live, owned pipelines require less time than managing paid-lead platforms while producing higher-quality conversations and more reliable conversion results.

How much should I budget for building an owned pipeline?

At eXp Realty, all essential tools, CRM, marketing automation, and cloud support, are included in the standard $85 monthly fee. Agents who join Smart Agent Alliance receive additional free systems worth over $7,000 annually, making pipeline ownership nearly cost-free.

Can I still use purchased leads while I build an owned system?

Yes. Many agents run both concurrently. The key is to transfer purchased leads into your CRM, tag them properly, and nurture them through your own sequences. This turns rented contacts into owned relationships that strengthen your long-term database.

What’s the biggest mistake agents make when building a pipeline?

Neglecting consistent follow-up. Most leads convert after multiple touches, not one. A CRM with automation and reminders ensures no contact slips through the cracks, protecting both your pipeline and your income.
excerpt: Should you rent leads vs own pipeline real estate? Learn why building your own database with Smart Agent Alliance creates freedom and sustainable growth at eXp.

title: How Collaboration, Events, and Global Connection Actually Work
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Realty community is not a vibe or a slogan. It is an operating layer built into the brokerage. Agents collaborate daily across markets, attend live events that actually drive production, and plug into a global network that makes a large brokerage feel personal. Community at eXp exists at three levels: daily collaboration, live events, and local connection. Smart Agent Alliance adds an additional layer of structured community on top.

TL;DR About eXp Realty Community

  • eXp agents collaborate instead of competing because the model removes local scarcity.
  • Daily collaboration happens inside eXp World, eXp Hub, and sponsor-led masterminds.
  • Live events like EXPCON and regional rallies turn online relationships into real-world momentum.
  • Local meetups and global locations keep the cloud brokerage grounded.
  • Smart Agent Alliance adds consistent, organized collaboration inside the larger eXp ecosystem.

Most brokerages talk about culture. Few design for it.

At many traditional firms, “community” means occasional office meetings, surface-level networking, or competition disguised as camaraderie. At eXp Realty, community is built into how agents work, learn, and grow. Collaboration is not optional or accidental. It is structural.

This page is the hub for our eXp Realty Community series. Below is a big-picture map of how collaboration, events, and global connection actually function at eXp, with links to deep-dive guides for each piece so you can explore what matters most to you.

Table of Contents

How eXp Realty Community Is Structured
Daily Collaboration Inside eXp Realty
eXp World and eXp Hub
Live Events and In-Person Connection
EXPCON and Major Company Events
Regional Rallies and Market-Specific Events
Sponsor and Community Events
Local Connection Without Traditional Offices
Agent-Led Local Meetups
Global Locations and Workspace Access
Where Sponsorship Fits Into eXp Community
How Smart Agent Alliance Enhances eXp Realty Community
Why eXp Realty Community Matters Before You Join

How eXp Realty Community Is Structured

eXp is a cloud brokerage, but that does not mean agents operate in isolation. Instead of one physical office, eXp built multiple overlapping community layers:

  • Daily collaboration through virtual platforms
  • Live events that create momentum and relationships
  • Local connection through meetups and global office access
  • Sponsor teams that make a large brokerage feel small

Each layer serves a different purpose, but together they create a working community that supports production, learning, and long-term growth.

Daily Collaboration Inside eXp Realty

The core of eXp Realty community is daily collaboration. Agents do not wait for annual conferences to connect. They collaborate every week, often every day. At a high level, eXp Realty community is built around daily collaboration. Agents do not wait for annual conferences to connect.

eXp World and eXp Hub

eXp World is the company’s virtual campus where agents attend live training, host meetings, and collaborate across markets. eXp Hub functions as the always-on communication layer, where agents share strategies, referrals, and real-time problem solving.

This combination replaces the traditional office model with something more scalable. Instead of learning only from the agents in your zip code, you learn from producers across the country and around the world.

For a full breakdown of how multi-agent collaboration works day to day, explore eXp Collaboration in our deep-dive guide.

Live Events and In-Person Connection

Online collaboration is powerful. Live events are where relationships deepen and momentum accelerates.

EXPCON and Major Company Events

EXPCON is eXp Realty’s flagship event. It brings agents together for multi-day training, strategy, leadership updates, and networking that actually leads to referrals and partnerships. This is where agents meet the people they have been collaborating with all year and turn digital relationships into real business.

Regional Rallies and Market-Specific Events

Between major conferences, eXp hosts regional rallies designed around local markets. These events focus on market-specific strategies, regional networking, and practical execution. They help bridge the gap between big-picture ideas and daily production.

Sponsor and Community Events

In addition to company-hosted events, some sponsor organizations host their own in-person gatherings. These are not required by eXp, but the best sponsor teams use them to strengthen connection, collaboration, and accountability.

To see how EXPCON, regional rallies, and sponsor-hosted events actually work, explore eXp Events in our full deep-dive guide.

Local Connection Without Traditional Offices

Even though eXp does not rely on brick-and-mortar offices, local connection still matters.

Agent-Led Local Meetups

Many eXp agents organize local meetups on their own. These range from casual coffee meetups to structured masterminds. Because the culture is collaborative rather than competitive, these gatherings tend to focus on sharing what works, not posturing.

Global Locations and Workspace Access

eXp agents also have access to physical meeting and workspace options through global office partnerships. This allows agents to meet clients, collaborate locally, or work while traveling, without being tied to a single office location.

You can explore how global access works and where agents can meet in person on the eXp Realty Locations page.

Where Sponsorship Fits Into eXp Community

Sponsorship at eXp exists alongside the brokerage, not above it. eXp provides the platform, systems, and global network. Sponsors determine how much additional community they create.

Many sponsors provide little or no ongoing connection. Some operate informal groups. A small number build structured communities with regular collaboration, training, and live interaction.

Smart Agent Alliance is one of those organized sponsor teams.

How Smart Agent Alliance Enhances eXp Realty Community

Smart Agent Alliance operates alongside eXp Realty’s community structure, adding an additional layer of organized collaboration.

Agents who join eXp Realty through a Smart Agent Alliance–aligned sponsor gain access to:

  • Weekly live collaboration calls with clear agendas
  • Consistent mastermind-style discussions led by active producers
  • Cross-market referral collaboration inside a smaller, trusted network
  • In-person meetups at major eXp events

This gives agents a “small room inside a big building.” You keep full access to eXp’s global community while also having a tighter group where people know your business, your goals, and your challenges.

Why eXp Realty Community Matters Before You Join

Most agents compare brokerages by splits and caps, not by how much time, money, and effort they will need to invest after joining to build systems, get support, or create leverage beyond transactions. Those costs often appear later in the form of software subscriptions, training programs, marketing assets, and trial and error.

At eXp Realty, agents join the brokerage directly and receive the same core platform, including compliance, compensation, and technology. What varies widely is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with and how much real infrastructure exists beyond the brokerage itself.

Smart Agent Alliance operates as organized sponsor support inside eXp Realty for agents who want more capability without giving up independence. Access is included at no cost for agents who join through an SAA-aligned sponsor, and participation in all resources is optional. Agents aligned with Smart Agent Alliance also receive everything provided by the Wolf Pack, one of eXp Realty’s most established and successful sponsor organizations, without choosing between systems or paying additional fees.

In the context of community and collaboration, this difference shapes how connected or isolated agents feel once they join. As a result, much of the work agents often end up doing on their own is already built and maintained for them. Smart Agent Alliance provides infrastructure for leadership access, collaboration, training, and optional agent attraction support, making it easier to grow inside eXp without rebuilding systems from scratch. Much of this value exists on the open market and can be purchased independently. Here, it is already in place.

With no cost to join, no obligation to participate, and full control retained, agents effectively have nothing to lose and meaningful support to gain, whether they are brand-new, experienced producers, or team leaders.

Full details are available on the Smart Agent Alliance eXp Realty sponsor page.

Frequently Asked Questions 

How does a virtual real estate community support agent collaboration at eXp Realty?

A virtual real estate community allows agents to collaborate without geographic limits. At eXp Realty, agents connect through platforms like eXp World and eXp Hub to share referrals, attend training, ask questions, and collaborate across markets in real time.

Is the eXp Realty community only online?

No. While eXp Realty operates as a cloud brokerage, agents also connect through in-person events, regional meetups, masterminds, and national conferences. The community combines virtual collaboration with real-world relationship building.

Do eXp agents actually collaborate, or is community mostly marketing?

Collaboration at eXp Realty is built into daily operations. Agents regularly exchange referrals, participate in live training, and engage in sponsor-led groups designed for practical collaboration rather than marketing alone.

Are eXp events and community activities required for agents?

No. Participation in eXp Realty community events and activities is optional. Agents choose their level of involvement based on their goals, schedule, and preferred working style.

Do all eXp Realty sponsors provide the same level of community?

No. While eXp Realty provides core community platforms, the level of additional organization, leadership, and engagement varies by sponsor. Community support depends on the sponsor an agent aligns with.

How does Smart Agent Alliance differ from the general eXp Realty community?

Smart Agent Alliance operates as a sponsor-led layer within eXp Realty, providing organized leadership access, systems, and collaboration beyond the brokerage’s baseline community for agents who choose to participate.
excerpt: Learn how eXp Realty community actually works, from daily collaboration and EXPCON events to global locations and sponsor-led connection.

title: High-Quality Leads Await With Revenos: eXp Realty’s Secret Sauce!
content:
Key Takeaways: Revenos is eXp Realty’s internal referral and lead division that connects qualified buyers and sellers with trained eXp agents through structured programs. Leads are matched, not sold in bulk, and most programs operate on a pay-at-closing referral model rather than upfront ad spend.

TL;DR About Revenos Leads at eXp Realty

  • Revenos is eXp Realty’s in-house lead and referral division
  • Leads are matched to agents based on experience and certification
  • Programs focus on relocation, affinity groups, military, REO, investors, and sellers
  • Most leads are referral-based with fees paid at closing
  • All training and certifications are included for eXp agents
  • Revenos supplements, not replaces, other eXp lead systems

Real estate agent leads are one of the biggest friction points in the industry. Most agents are forced to choose between expensive paid leads or inconsistent self-generated marketing. eXp Realty takes a different approach by operating an internal division dedicated entirely to sourcing and distributing qualified opportunities to its agents.

Revenos functions as that division. It is not a single lead source, but a structured ecosystem of referral and demand-based programs designed to route real consumers to trained eXp agents.

This article explains how Revenos fits into the broader eXp Realty lead ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

eXp Realty’s Quality Leads
Revenos Magic￼
Revenos Benefits￼
How to Get Revenos Leads￼
 Revenos Programs Explained
ExpressOffers
eXp Affinity
eXp Relocation
eXp Honor Military Rewards
eXp REO (Real Estate Owned)
Institutional Investment Services
eXp Bundle Select Program
Making it Rain
 Realtor Leads Pay at Closing￼
What Agents Also Ask About Revenos Leads
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions
Related eXp Realty Lead Guides

eXp Realty’s Quality Leads

Real estate agent leads at eXp are the best in the business. This isn’t just a claim; it’s a proven fact. These quality leads are super special! They go WAY beyond the typical low-quality ones that result from someone clicking on some ad or phoning into a brokerage office.

Of course, eXp Realty provides those too, but what sets them apart is their dedicated real estate agent leads division, Revenos. This full-time division, stocked with a skilled team, leverages eXp Realty’s extensive network to unearth quality leads for eXp Realty agents.

And it’s working! In 2024, Revenos provided thousands of top-quality real estate agent leads, generating over $2 billion in closed sales for eXp agents. The year 2025 promises even more success!

Revenos Magic

Revenos is lead magic for agents. Why?

  • Quality Lead Sources: Revenos does the heavy lifting to find and nurture top-tier lead sources.
  • High Conversions by Matching Leads with Agents: Revenos digs deep, identifying client characteristics that match them perfectly with an eXp agent. For instance, if a client loves hiking, Revenos will find an agent who shares that passion, creating a connection that boosts value and successful closings.
  • Agent Choices with Different Programs: Revenos offers eight distinct programs under its umbrella. Each program provides a specific type of lead, allowing agents to choose what suits them best. These programs include ExpressOffers, eXp Affinity, eXp Relocation, eXp Honor Military Rewards, eXp REO (Real Estate Owned), Institutional Investment Services, Bundle Select, and Making It Rain.

Revenos Benefits

Revenos leads are, as CEO Leo Pareja states, “an unparalleled offering in the real estate industry.” Here’s why:

Exclusive to eXp Agents: All leads are exclusively for eXp agents.

Continuous Growth: Revenos growth is exploding with its:

  • Strategic Network Expansion: Revenos is always looking for new opportunities.
  • Informative Training: Revenos offers actionable training to set agents up for success.
  • Proven Success: Revenos demonstrates a record of delivering quality leads and referrals.

How to Get Revenos Leads

  • Become an eXp Agent: Join the eXp Realty family and remember to pick a great eXp sponsor like Smart Agent Alliance.
  • Get Training: Enroll in the Revenos certification training program of your choice to gain the knowledge, confidence, and expertise needed to represent clients exceptionally.  Or, better yet, enroll in all the Revenos certification training programs so you’ll be set to conquer any lead type.
  • Gain Qualifications: Gain the standards preferred by Revenos clients to increase your chances of being chosen for the real estate leads.
  • Note the Gray Area: Even if you don’t meet a client’s preferred qualifications, there are situations when you will still be the chosen agent.  So don’t delay in getting certified for maximum opportunity.

 Revenos Programs Explained

Let’s get into the various eXp referral programs and their agent qualifications. Remember, all programs are open to all eXp Agents, and all training is completely FREE. And, yes, this is on top of the arsenal of other eXp training.

ExpressOffers

ExpressOffers is a platform that aggregates multiple iBuyers (including Opendoor), ready to quickly make cash offers to sellers. eXp agents are assigned these quality leads and can earn commissions from both negotiating terms with the seller and listing the home if the iBuyer puts it back on the market.

  • Certification Format: On-Demand Course
  • Preferred Client Qualifications: ExpressOffers Certification only

eXp Affinity

eXp Affinity partners with large companies that provide various real estate-related services to their clients. Revenos forms relationships with these companies to be their source of supplying real estate agents. eXp Affinity currently includes five companies that provide these quality leads to eXp agents.

Certification Format: One Live Class offered once a month

Client Qualifications:  Agents should meet the specific qualifications of the providing company.  Currently, those preferred client qualifications start with full-time agents who have been licensed for 2 years and have done 12 transactions in the prior 12 months.

eXp Relocation

eXp Relocation works with corporations to provide services to their employees who need to transfer to a different location. eXp Relocations matches local eXp agents to these corporate transferee clients.

Certification Format: Live courses

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Minimum of one year of experience

eXp Honor Military Rewards

eXp Honor Military Rewards assists active duty, veterans, and retired service members from our US armed forces with their real estate needs.

Certification Format: Get Relocations certified in live courses

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Minimum of one year of experience

eXp REO (Real Estate Owned)

eXp agents manage and list REO properties, providing expertise in assisting financial institutions, investors, and government agencies. REO refers to any property that is taken back through either a legal foreclosure, Deed in Lieu of Foreclosure, or any other properties or notes purchased at a court foreclosure auction. REO properties may also be called Corporate Owned, Bank Owned, or Bank Repo properties.

Certification Format: Live Training

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Minimum of two years of REO experience; licensed for at least three years; experience in repair management, renovations, or property management; possesses a network of local vendors.

Institutional Investment Services

Institutional Investment Services helps some of the world’s largest landlords invest in or sell single-family rental properties by connecting them with top-performing eXp agents for expert support.

Certification Format: live training

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Experience working with investors

eXp Bundle Select Program

Bundle Select offers bundled real estate services to corporations and organizations, saving employees 20% or more on transaction fees and providing 24/7 concierge support.

Revenos provides eXp agents with customized websites and videos to educate corporations and organizations about Bundle Select’s immense value.

This is not a little deal! Currently, over 6 million employees are already on the Bundle Select Platform, including Adobe, Visa, Salesforce, Progressive, Perks at Work, and more!

Certification Format: One Live Class offered twice per month

Preferred Client Qualifications:  None, but driven by eXp agents with corporate and organization connections.

Additional Perks: eXp agents generating accounts earn a 25% referral fee from all business done through the corporations/organizations they bring into Bundle Select.

Additional Requirements: $1000 yearly subscription fee

Making it Rain

Making it Rain leverages the power of digital ads to build a client database for eXp agents that keeps on giving.  These ads are designed and placed by eXp’s expert staff, saving eXp agents time and money.

Certification Format:  On-Demand Courses with prerequisite introductory courses for each lead generation product, each taking 45 minutes to complete.

Preferred Client Qualifications:  None

Additional Requirements: eXp agents pay for these cost-effective and affordable ads (they start at just $250 per month).

 Realtor Leads Pay at Closing

Aside from ExpressOffers and Making It Rain, all other Revenos programs charge a referral fee at closing for the eXp agent who secures the business. These fees range from 25% to 55%, and they are well worth it for the quality business you gain. Plus, any future referral business you earn from doing a great job is all yours to keep—no more fees to Revenos.

This is a fantastic opportunity for agents because:

  • Superior Lead Quality: Revenos leads are nothing like the 25% – 40% fees you pay to Realtor.com for Opcity leads, which are often low quality and rarely close. With Revenos, you’re investing in high-quality leads that convert.
  • Top Agent Pay: eXp Realty offers some of the highest agent pay in the real estate industry. Top agents can even earn more than 100% of their commission each year. If you’re not familiar with eXp Realty’s pay structure yet, check out our blog “2024 Guide to eXp Realty Commission and Fees” or visit our website at Smart Agent Alliance.

And there you have it.  eXp Realty with its Revenos division is the only real estate brokerage company constantly working and succeeding in supplying agents with quality leads. No other brokerage has a lead program like Revenos. That’s one of the advantages of being an agent at the most profitable brokerage out there, that’s the most agent-centric brokerage on the planet.

What Agents Also Ask About Revenos Leads

Are Revenos leads exclusive to eXp agents?
Yes. Revenos programs are available only to licensed eXp Realty agents who meet eligibility requirements and complete any required training or certification. These referral and lead programs are operated internally by eXp Realty and are not accessible to agents affiliated with other brokerages.

Do agents pay upfront for Revenos leads?
Most Revenos programs operate on a referral-fee-at-closing model rather than upfront lead purchases. Agents typically pay a percentage only when a transaction successfully closes. Making It Rain is the primary exception, as it involves paid advertising spend rather than referral fees.

How quickly do Revenos leads convert in practice?
Conversion timelines vary by program and lead type. Some Revenos leads are transaction-ready, while others involve relocation, affinity, or long-term planning scenarios that may take months to convert. Agents should expect a mix of short-term and longer-cycle opportunities.

Does Revenos replace other lead sources at eXp Realty?
No. Revenos is designed to supplement, not replace, other lead sources such as organic marketing, sphere referrals, CRM-based lead capture, and additional eXp programs like Zoocasa or BoldTrail. Agents typically layer Revenos alongside other lead channels based on capacity.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Programs like eXp Realty’s Revenos Leads are designed to provide centralized, brokerage-supported lead opportunities, but they do not operate in isolation or replace the broader eXp Realty experience.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

Agents who join eXp Realty and name a Smart Agent Alliance (SAA) aligned agent as sponsor gain access to organized sponsor infrastructure designed to preserve long-term optionality. This access includes done-for-you systems made available without cost or obligation.

Smart Agent Alliance is directly aligned with the Wolf Pack, one of eXp Realty’s most established sponsor organizations. Through this alignment, agents gain access to Wolf Pack training resources that are otherwise available for purchase, along with participation in the Wolf Pack community, without additional fees.

Full details are available on the Smart Agent Alliance eXp Realty sponsor page.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Revenos mandatory for eXp agents?

No. All Revenos programs are optional and require agents to enroll and complete any required certifications. eXp Realty agents can operate entirely without Revenos and still access the brokerage’s core platform, tools, and other lead sources. Revenos exists as an additional lead option, not a requirement.

Do all eXp agents qualify for Revenos leads?

All licensed eXp agents may apply for Revenos programs, but eligibility varies by program. Some offerings require a minimum transaction history, specific certifications, or completion of training before access is granted. These requirements exist to ensure agents are prepared to handle the lead types involved.

Are Revenos referral fees negotiable?

No. Referral fees are set by each Revenos program and are disclosed in advance of participation. Fees are standardized to maintain consistency across agents and markets. Agents agree to the referral terms as part of enrollment, and fees are applied only when a transaction successfully closes.

Can agents participate in multiple Revenos programs at the same time?

Yes. Agents may participate in more than one Revenos program concurrently, provided they meet the certification, experience, and capacity requirements for each. Agents are expected to manage response times and follow-up effectively, as stacking programs without sufficient capacity can reduce conversion success.

Does Revenos availability vary by market?

Yes. Revenos lead volume and program availability depend on geography, partner relationships, and consumer demand. Some programs are more active in certain regions than others. Availability may change over time as new partnerships are added or demand shifts within specific markets.

Related eXp Realty Lead Guides

Revenos works alongside several other lead programs in the eXp Realty ecosystem. If you are evaluating how agents build pipeline inside eXp, these guides provide additional context:

  • Zoocasa Leads
    How eXp-owned Zoocasa delivers high-intent online leads paired with coaching.
  • Making It Rain eXp Realty
    How company-managed PPC campaigns generate buyer and seller opportunities.
  • BoldTrail Leads

How CRM-integrated paid lead systems support buyer and seller pipelines.
excerpt: Unlock the secret to high-quality leads with eXp Realty’s Revenos program! Discover how to boost your real estate income with targeted leads.
